content: The Act titled "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by repealing the dollar limitation and increasing the phaseout beginning point based on modified adjusted gross income. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by adjusting the phaseout based on modified adjusted gross income, excluding certain sections. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by adjusting the phaseout based on modified adjusted gross income. Section 221(f)(1) of the tax code is amended to increase certain dollar amounts for taxable years beginning after 2008. The amendments made by the "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. SEC. 3. Deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses made permanent. Repeal of termination of Section 222 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Effective date applies to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. SEC. 4. Education savings accounts. Increase in allowable contributions from $2,000 to $5,000 for section 530(b)(1)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Reports under section 530 amended to be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for amendments is specified. The amendments made by this section will apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2007. SEC. 5. Allowance of room, board, and special needs services for scholarships and tuition reduction programs in higher education. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for qualified higher education expenses at eligible educational institutions. The terms are defined in section 529(e) of the Code. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows for qualified higher education expenses at eligible educational institutions, with changes to tuition reduction programs for teaching and research assistants. Effective after December 31, 2007, expenses paid in taxable years ending. Expenses for education after December 31, 2007, are eligible for tax deductions. SEC. 6. Expansion of educational expenses allowed for Hope Scholarship Credit. Expansion of qualified tuition and related expenses for the Hope Scholarship Credit to include fees, books, supplies, and equipment required for courses at eligible educational institutions. Hope Scholarship Credit not affected by Federal Pell Grants. The Hope Scholarship Credit is expanded to cover fees, books, supplies, and equipment for courses at eligible educational institutions. The credit is not reduced by Federal Pell Grants or Supplemental Educational Opportunity Grants. The amendments made by this section apply to expenses paid after December 31, 2007, for education furnished in academic periods beginning after that date. Title IX of the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 exempts subtitles A, B, and D of title IV from the sunset provisions.
